availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Herndon (Henderson County, Kentucky, clerk and notary public)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, clerk and notary public. Kentucky native. Son of John C. Herndon and Margaret Clark Herndon. Married to Julia Dimmett Herndon. Resident in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk in Boyle County 1860. Commissioned notary public in Henderson County on October 30, 1862. Clerk in Henderson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 105A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, p. 907.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Henderson County, KY, July 1863, p. 243.
"Death Comes," Courier Journal (Louisville, Ky.), Aug 2, 1905, p. 10
